Diabetes includes conditions characterised by chronic hyperglycaemia.

The definition of diabetes is based on the risk of long-term retinopathy. This risk was established on the basis of the results of epidemiological studies, which showed a risk of retinopathy for fasting blood glucose levels in excess of 1.26 g/l (7 mmol/l).

<ref>CEEDMM, 2019</ref>

question.title: What is the definition of diabetes based on?
question.description: The definition of diabetes is based on the risk of long-term retinopathy. What type of risk is this?

option_a.title: The risk of cardiovascular disease
option_a.description: A risk associated with diabetes, but not the basis for its definition

option_b.title: The risk of long-term retinopathy
option_b.description: The correct answer, based on epidemiological studies

option_c.title: The risk of nephropathy
option_c.description: Another complication associated with diabetes, but not the basis for its definition

option_d.title: The risk of neuropathy
option_d.description: A complication associated with diabetes, but not the basis for its definition
